Round an Interpolated Series

Source: R/utilities.R
round_na.interp.Rd

Wraps round around na.interp to provide a rounded interpolated series, which is then enforced to be greater than or equal to a minimum value (default min_val = 0) via pmax.

round_na.interp(
  x,
  lambda = NULL,
  linear = (frequency(x) <= 1 | sum(!is.na(x)) <= 2 * frequency(x)),
  digits = 0,
  min_val = 0
)

Arguments

x

A time series passed directly to na.interp.

lambda

Box-Cox transformation parameter passed directly to na.interp.

linear

logical indicator of if linear interpolation should be used. Passed directly to na.interp.

digits

integer or numeric integer of how many digits to round to. Passed directly to round.

min_val

integer or numeric integer of minimum value allowable in the series.

Value

numeric series.

Examples

  round_na.interp(x = c(1, 2, 3, NA, NA, 170))
  round_na.interp(x = c(-1, 2, 3, NA, NA, 170), min_val = 1)

Contents
